Content: Nathaniel tightened the laces on his left skate and used his hockey stick for balance as he climbed to his feet. E͟y͟e͟i͟n͟g͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟p͟r͟a͟c͟t͟i͟c͟e͟ ͟g͟o͟a͟l͟ ͟a͟t͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟f͟a͟r͟ ͟e͟n͟d͟ ͟o͟f͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟f͟r͟o͟z͟e͟n͟ ͟p͟o͟n͟d͟ ͟h͟e͟ ͟s͟l͟i͟p͟p͟e͟d a puck from his coat pocket and dropped it to the ice.

I͟f͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟w͟o͟r͟l͟d͟ ͟w͟e͟r͟e͟ ͟t͟o͟ ͟f͟a͟l͟l͟ ͟a͟w͟a͟y͟, Nathaniel would be happy as long as the glassy surface of the pond remained. The only sound was the kishkish of his skates scratching the i͟c͟e͟ ͟h͟e pushed the previous evening’s playoff game from his mind. Nathaniel forgot about his missed penalty shot, his t͟e͟a͟m͟m͟a͟t͟e͟’͟s͟ ͟d͟i͟s͟a͟p͟p͟o͟i͟n͟t͟e͟d͟ ͟f͟a͟c͟e͟s, and his coach’s promise of a championship the following year.

Out here Nathaniel was not the mediocre player who had botched the m͟o͟r͟e͟ ͟i͟m͟p͟o͟r͟t͟a͟n͟t shot of the game. No, out here he was an ice hockey superstar. The pond was a professional ice hockey arena. The squirrels and birds nestled in the nearby trees were fans screaming for his autograph. His substitute g͟o͟a͟l͟i͟e͟,͟ ͟a͟n͟ ͟o͟v͟e͟r͟t͟u͟r͟n͟e͟d͟ ͟g͟a͟r͟b͟a͟g͟e͟ ͟c͟a͟n͟,͟ ͟m͟o͟c͟k͟e͟d͟ ͟h͟i͟m͟ ͟l͟i͟k͟e͟ ͟a͟ ͟r͟e͟a͟l͟-͟l͟i͟f͟e͟ ͟o͟p͟p͟o͟n͟e͟n͟t.

Gathering speed, Nathaniel w͟e͟n͟t͟ ͟a͟r͟o͟u͟n͟d͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟b͟a͟c͟k͟ ͟p͟a͟r͟t͟ ͟o͟f͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟ ͟g͟o͟a͟l͟ ͟a͟n͟d͟ ͟t͟h͟e͟n͟ ͟m͟o͟v͟e͟d toward center ice. With the puck now in position, he pulled back his stick and swung down with all his might.
